title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [4 april 1860]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [4 April 1860]
text: Walterit is so strange you have not got my letter I sent one last fridayFriday morning and should have written more particularly but Jeff said he would write to you the first of last week but when he was home on sundaySunday he said he had not written I have just received your letter and have had all you have sent and come very acceptable I had got down to 10 cents you must have got my letter before this I wrote how very sick Andrew was he has been very bad with the pleuresypleurisy so they let no one go in to see him we have all done what we could I have been there and Jeff and Martha and George I did not go yesterday he is been gaining since last fridayFriday thursdayThursday he was very bad but yesterday he was quite smart I sent Eddy to see) Walt there was a letter come from Boston wanted A Book and I made a mistake and put some other in the letter I send you so I will send it in this I am very glad to hear from hannah I shall write to her I wrote Walt for you to send me five dollars if you possibly can the first of next week to help get along with the rent of April after that I hope we shall not have such A scratch great times acrosstacross the street with the election George was at the tribune office last night untilluntil 1 Oclocko'clock waiting to hear the returns the greatest crowd and excitement he says he Jesse is working he wants to come home I told him I had hired so much of the house out he would have to hire his board write Walt if you got my letterwe are all well good bieI am glad you are so well pleased with BostonWednesday 4 April 1860 (To W. in Boston) Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [4 April 1860]
